item.title: Karen add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "It's strange how teachers can go off to college for all those years to learn to become teachers, but some of them never learn the easy stuff. Like making kids laugh. And making sure they know that you love them." -- Matthew Dicks

item.title: Karen add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "You have to be the bravest person in the world to go out every day, being yourself when no one likes who you are." -- Matthew Dicks

item.title: Karen add a quote by Carrie Fisher
item.description: "If my life wasn't funny it would just be true, and that is unacceptable." -- Carrie Fisher

item.title: Karen add a quote by Ransom Riggs
item.description: "We cling to our fairy tales until the price for believing in them becomes too high." -- Ransom Riggs

item.title: Karen add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "My country, right or wrong,” is a thing that no patriot would think of saying except in a desperate case. It is like saying, “My mother, drunk or sober." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Ransom Riggs
item.description: "That's quite a performance you gave earlier [...] I'm sure the theater lost a fine actor when you chose to devote yourself to murder and cannibalism." -- Ransom Riggs

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry McMillan
item.description: "Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do." -- Terry McMillan

item.title: Karen add a quote by Elaine May
item.description: "You know how sometimes you lie in bed at night and think, “What if the law of gravity just wears out and lets go and I drift into space?” Does that ever make you anxious?" -- Elaine May

item.title: Karen add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Of all the preposterous assumptions of humanity over humanity, nothing exceeds most of the criticisms made on the habits of the poor by the well-housed, well- warmed, and well-fed." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will." -- Stephen King

item.title: Karen add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "Everyone is someone's devil." -- Matthew Dicks

item.title: Karen add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Karen add a quote by James Thurber
item.description: "Two is company, four is a party, three is a crowd. One is a wanderer." -- James Thurber

item.title: Karen add a quote by Matthew Dicks
item.description: "I step through the door anyway, knowing that the hard thing and the right thing are usually the same thing." -- Matthew Dicks

item.title: Karen add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Karen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Karen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Karen add a quote by Stan Lee
item.description: "Face front, true believers!" -- Stan Lee

item.title: Karen add a quote by Washington Irving
item.description: "There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love." -- Washington Irving

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jerry Garcia
item.description: "What a long strange trip it's been." -- Jerry Garcia

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I am selfish, private and easily bored. Will this be a problem?" -- Neil Gaiman
